meanings.definition: To produce shoots or branches from the base of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The young corn plants tillered beautifully in the rich soil.
meanings.sent2: The wheat tillered vigorously after the first rains.
meanings.sent3: The farmer chuckled as he watched the rice plants tillered in perfect rows.
meanings.sent4: The garden seemed to dance as the plants tillered in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The field was a sea of green as the crops tillered under the sun.

meanings.sent1: The tillered plants provided extra support to the main stalks.
meanings.sent2: The tillered wheat field looked lush and healthy.
meanings.sent3: The garden appeared tillered and ready for a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent4: The forest was a tillered paradise, full of young trees.
meanings.sent5: The tillered area of the field was a haven for small animals.

meanings.sent1: The grass tillered quickly in the open field.
meanings.sent2: The crop tillered profusely, promising a good yield.
meanings.sent3: The garden tillered with enthusiasm, reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent4: The plants tillered like a symphony, each adding its own note.
meanings.sent5: The field tillered gracefully, creating a picturesque scene.
